result.execSummary:
The defendant Daleon D Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Daleon D Jackson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daleon D Jackson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Daleon D Jackson was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, fees, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in educational programming or vocational programming or a combination of both.

No contact with the victim.
No contact with nonbiological children under the age of 16 years without permission of the agent.
Defendant is prohibited from participating in social media.  Defendant may have an email account. 
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal substances.
Register/comply with the sex offender registry.

Any electronic devices must be turned over to agent for inspection upon demand.
Register/comply with the sex offender registry.

supervisions.notes: Court recommends the defendant participate in the Denier's Group treatment and therapy as mentioned in the Presentence Investigation Report.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendasnt that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

cf

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
At the hour of 12:46 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and NOT GUILTY as to COUNT 2 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict on COUNT 1 and granted defense motion for judgment of acquittal on COUNT 2.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on COUNT 1 and ordered judgment of acquittal on COUNT 2.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Court ordered the Department of Corrections to conduct an evaluation pursuant to sec. 972.15(1m) Wis. Stats. 
Exhibit list received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Jury in the box: 10:05 a.m. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:09 a.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Gaidosh and Terrell who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Trial continued. Jury in the box: 1:11 p.m. Continued testimony of Milwaukee Police Detective Behning. Exhibit 1 published to the jury. Jury out of the box: 2:09 p.m. Discussion regarding statements made in the video-recorded statement. Jury in the box: 2:19 p.m. Continued testimony of Milwaukee Police Detective Behning. Exhibit 2 received. State rests. Jury out of the box: 2:47 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Additional arguments by both parties regarding the sidebar placed on the record. Defense counsel motion to dismiss denied at the close of the State's case denied by the Court. Discussion regarding defense witnesses. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court finds the defendant knowingly waived his right to remain silent. Jury in the box: 3:16 p.m. Sworn for the Defense: Daleon Jackson. Jury out of the box: 3:47 p.m. Jury in the box: 4:05 p.m. Sworn for the defense: Milwaukee Police Officer Jody Young. Defense rests. State has no rebuttal. Testimony closed. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:15 p.m. Sidebar placed on the record. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Case adjourned to 6/10/15 at 9:30 a.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard as to the State's motion in limine numbers 9 & 10. Court ordered testimony be taken. Sworn for the State: M.J.D-S. dob 12/15/02. Testimony closed. Additional arguments heard. Court granted the State's motions in limine listed as numbers 9 & 10 for reasons stated on the record. Jury in the box: 9:55 a.m. Sworn for the State: James S., M.J.D-S. dob 12/15/02. Jury out of the box: 10:43 a.m. Jury in this box: 10:57 a.m. Continued testimony of M.J.D-S. dob 12/15/02., Milwaukee Police Detective Tim Behning. Exhibit 1 received. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 11:50 a.m. Case adjourned to 1:00 p.m. for continuation of jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Deputy court clerk ccp.
Jury Selection continued. State placed offer on the record. Court made rulings as to the State's motion in limine. Jury panel in the box. Voir dire continued. Jury out of the box: 2:42 p.m. Juror #11 in court: 2:43 p.m. Private voir dire of juror #11. Juror #11 out of the box: 2:48 p.m. Juror #30 in court: 2:49 p.m. Private voir dire of juror #30. Juror #30 out of the box: 2:20 p.m. Jury panel in the box: 2:52 p.m. Continued voir dire. Jury out of the box: 3:12 p.m. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. Jury in the box: 3:22 p.m. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Jury out of the box: 3:40 p.m. Discussion regarding jury instructions. Case passed to address court calendar. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Discussion regarding video-recorded statement. Court ordered the parties discuss and draft a curative instruction as to the statement. Defense counsel objected to the defendant being in custody. Court noted defense counsel's objection for the record. Jury in the box: 4:16 p.m. Court instructed jury. Opening statements by state and defense. Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 4:49 p.m. Court will rule on the State's proposed evidence in the morning. Court ordered witness sequestration. Case adjourned to 6/09/15 at 9:00 a.m. for continuation jury trial in Branch 25.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:30 a.m.  Court instructed jury. Jury out of the box: 12:06 p.m. Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. for continuation of jury selection in Branch 25.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Daleon D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Court made rulings on State's motion in limine. Case passed to address court calendar.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel moved to withdraw the speedy trial demand entered on 04/13/2015. State did not object. Upon questioning by the Court, the defendant did not wish to waive his speedy trial demand. Speedy trial demand remains in effect. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/08/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
State's supplementatl witness list received and filed.
Proposed jury instructions from the defense received and filed.
Motion to adjourn June 8, 2015 trial from the defense received and filed.

Court received a call from the defense attorney requesting that this case be brought into Court prior to the  06/08/2015 jury trial. Per the defense, the State does not object.  Case will be added to the calendar on 06/05/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel previously filed a Miranda/Goodchild motion. Discussion regarding scope of the motion. Motion hearing proceeded. State relied upon the DVD of the defendant's statement and requested the Court receive the DVD into the record. DVD of defendant's statement previously filed on 5/11/15 marked as Exhibit 1 and received. Court granted State's request. State rests. Sworn for the defense: Daleon Jackson. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Additional arguments heard from both parties. Court took a brief break to review motions. Back on the record. Appearances remain the same. The Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Exhibit List received and filed. Court ordered Exhibit 1 remain in the court file. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 6/08/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms submitted by the State received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
DVD of defendant's statements to Detective Behning received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion to Determine the Admissibility of Mr. Jackson's 3/24/15 Statement to Detective Timothy Behning received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter from the defendant with attached pro se motion to dismiss received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Pro se motion: Motion to dismiss from the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Daleon D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defendant previously entered a speedy trial demand on 4/13/15. Defense counsel may file a motion regarding the defendant's statements.   Parties to file motions by 5/07/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jody Young-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  Cynthia Davis for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, officer did not receive subpeona.  Defense has no objection at this time to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MJD-S (12/15/02) OR HER FATHER JAMES S. (5/18/69) OR HIS FAMILY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daleon D Jackson in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Daleon D Jackson in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
